title: Go-live publish checklist and production verification for Encouragement navigation

requirements.summary: Prepare the frontend go-live release guidance and add a lightweight UI verification hook so production can be validated that “Show Me Encouragement” navigates and renders content without affecting Internet Identity or user state.
acceptanceCriteria: A production deployment is performed that updates both backend canister code and frontend assets to the latest version.
After deployment, the production app loads successfully and the Home screen “Show Me Encouragement” button navigates to the Encouragement screen and displays encouragement content as expected.
No breaking changes are introduced to authentication (Internet Identity) or existing user data/state as a result of the deployment.

file_operations.description: Add a go-live deployment runbook for the Internet Computer workflow including: building frontend assets, deploying to production, and a post-deploy smoke-check focused on Home -> “Show Me Encouragement” -> Encouragement content loading; explicitly call out that Internet Identity authentication and cached React Query user state must remain intact. Use the selected "authorization" component guidance as the reference for Internet Identity/auth expectations (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

Add a non-functional test hook (e.g., a stable data attribute and/or accessibility label) to the “Show Me Encouragement” button to make production smoke verification unambiguous, without changing navigation behavior or impacting Internet Identity flows.
